page.title: 09The Public House.
page.content: There is only 1 pub in Blakesley/Wood end area.It is a free house,the Bartholomew Arms, formerly the Red Lion.The pub serves a wide variety of beers,lagers,wines and spirits and is noted for its real ale.Bar snacks are available at lunch times and during the evenings.There are 3 inter-connecting sections to the bar with a further bar, called Kate Street' available for functions.There is a beer garden which is popular in the summer months. Accomodation is available in the form of 4 double and 1 single rooms.The pub is H.Q.for the National Soap Box G.P. A darts tournament is run for the locals and a collection is made throughout the year in order to provide Christmas lunch for the retired people in the village.The pub is widely used by people from outside the area as well as local people.
